title: Accessing the UI - Bypass Okta
content:
First time logging in : When logging into the UI for the first time with a service account, you must create an Auth0 account to bypass Okta and set up MFA with Bitwarden. Please follow the steps below to enter your service account email, sign up on Auth0, add an authentication method like Google Authenticator, and save the TOTP code from Bitwarden to complete the login process successfully. [NOTE] If you do not currently have access to Bitwarden, you can request access here .[WARNING] If an account already exists in Okta, you will not be able to create a username/password login. Enter the email of your service account and click continue [Image] You will now be redirected to the Auth0 login screen. Click ‘Sign up’ [Image] Re-enter your email and password 
 [Image] [Image] 
 Only follow the next steps if you are being prompted to enroll in MFA. Next, you will be prompted to add another authentication method. Click ‘ Google Authenticator or similar’ [Image] Using your Bitwarden browser extension to create a new record, capture the QR code by clicking the camera icon next to the Authenticator Key (TOTP) box. [Image] Save your new record and copy the TOTP code and click continue You now should be logged into the UI. [INFO] Tips on how to manage Bitwarden records can be found here
